intro: Leptostachya obovata, commonly known as the broad-ovate lepso, is a species of flowering plant in the family Restionaceae. It is native to South Africa, where it typically grows in coastal and mountainous regions. The plant is characterized by its dense, grass-like foliage and produces small, clustered white flowers. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in sandy or rocky habitats. Due to its unique appearance and ecological significance, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
